conbody.p: The TDmac class is part of the PIL. It is a container for the DMA controller's channels, descriptors and descriptor headers. It also defines virtual functions for operations that require a PSL implementation.
You need to derive TDmac for each distinct type of DMA controller on your device, and implement these virtual functions.

section.p: The TDmac class contains several pure virtual functions that must be implemented by the PSL implementation:

These functions start and stop transfers on a DMA channel and are the main interface between the PIL and the PSL. The implementation of these functions depends on the hardware available for performing DMA, and on the characteristics used to specify a DMA transfer:

section.p: The DMA Framework manages the transfer descriptors according to the descriptor parameter passed into the TDmac constructor by the derived class constructor; the descriptor parameter is a TDmac::SCreateInfo structure. The per-request transfer parameters are passed into the descriptors for each request issued by a driver.

section.title: Implement the non-mandatory controller virtual functions
section.p: The following auxiliary functions are used to implement the scatter-gather transfer mode behavior by creating and manipulating the linked list of transfer fragment headers that describe a given scatter-gather transaction. They are called by the TDmac base class functions when the instance of the TDmac derived class reports itself as being capable of scatter-gather operations.

section.title: First scatter-gather support function: InitHwDes()
section.p: This is a function for creating a scatter-gather list. From the information in the passed-in request, the function sets up the descriptor with that fragment's:

ul.li: driver/DMA controller specific transfer parameters: memory/peripheral, burst size, transfer width.

section.title: Second scatter-gather support function: ChainHwDes()
section.p: If the framework needs to fragment the clientâ€™s request, either because of the transfer size or because the memory is not a single contiguous block, then the framework calls this function. It chains hardware descriptors together by setting the next pointer of the original descriptor to the physical address of the descriptor to be chained. It assumes that the DMAC channel is quiescent when called.

section.title: Third scatter-gather support function: AppendHwDes()
section.p: This function is called by the TDmac base class when a driver request is called for a channel that is still active, i.e. where the intent is to provide data streaming so that the target device is constantly provided with data; for example, an audio device playing a track. In this case, the function provided by the derived class must:

ul.li: stop the DMAC to prevent any corruption of the scatter-gather list while appending the new fragment descriptor
re-enable the channel, ideally before the target has detected the gap in service.
